body.name: Cisco Linksys E1500 Wireless-N WiFi Router with SpeedBoost (Certified Refurbished)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 12 hrs 50 mins
features: This Certified Refurbished product is manufacturer refurbished, shows limited or no wear, and includes all original accessories plus a 90-day warranty
body.description: The Linksys E1500 offers fast speed to connect your computers, wireless printers and other Wi-Fi devices at transfer rates up to 300 Mbps speed. Built with leading 802.11n wireless technology, the Linksys E1500 offers expanded range to create a powerful wireless network. MIMO antenna array boosts signal strength to provide reliable coverage so you can enjoy your wireless network from anywhere in your home. Higher quality antenna technology helps to maintain high speeds across greater distances throughout your home for maximum wireless coverage and in-home mobility. Keep Wi-Fi freeloaders and Internet threats at bay with WPA/WPA2 encryption and SPI firewall to help keep your network protected. Cisco Connect software helps you set up your home wireless network in three easy steps. Cisco Connect software helps you customize your settings, and quickly add multiple devices to your network: Create a separate, password protected network for guests Limit access time and websites with Parental Controls Access advanced network settings easily.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2012
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Linksys E1500 - Wireless N Wi Fi
reviews.reviewText: 100% excellent. came fast and on time. very well packed. It works great. Great team and a very good price very reasonable. I recommend this computer. I had this great brand for 5 years. its configuration is easy and simple to attach devices either via Wi Fi and through via ethernet cables.There are many criticisms of these teams, but I know the hints to beginners who claim to know and who are great technologists, and how to criticize and make up these teams, they and their headaches my sister's house is approximately 140 square meters and extends from the entrance door, kitchen, study room and both bedrooms. Have connected the following:1 printer epson - Shared., Connected Wi Fi2 Laptop, Wi Fi Connected1 Tablet Samsung, Wi Fi connected1 PC connected via LAN1 PS3 connected via a LAN.performance of this great router is the maximum.What recomiendo.100% excellent

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Such a bargain
reviews.reviewText: I upgraded to the E1500 from a 1st generation Apple AirPort Express 802.11n and couldn't be happier. Although the AirPort Express was 802.11n, I was never satisfied with the range and speed. I've had bad luck with other brands in the past, but the refurbished E1500 was cheap enough to warrant a gamble. Since installing, it's been rock solid and fast. I opted to forgo the Cisco software and configured the router with the web based setup. It's played nicely with all my devices and caused zero headaches. I stream HD to 2 Apple TVs and have 10 other devices logged in, but the router doesn't flinch.Don't spend more unless you really need it. Dual band wireless routers are overated as the 5ghz spectrum doesn't provide great coverage. For most homes, this router will get the job done.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cisco Linksys Factory Refurbished E1500 Wireless-N WiFi Router
reviews.reviewText: Installation was a breeze although it took me a minute to realize that there was a guest option. Because I gave this router the same name as my prior one I was confused. After fooling around, I realized this was a guest feature so that I wouldn't have to give my actual access point password. This is akin to wireless access at a coffee shop or a Barnes & Noble store.After installation, everything worked wonderfully except for streaming videos online, which was a major headache. I don't know how I stood after 2-3 weeks of frustration. I had printed the return label and was so ready to send it back to get something new when I stumbled upon the review section and read several similar observations/complaints. Some reviewers swore to never get a refurbished item again and I almost aligned with them. However, the trick is in the QoS default setting. After I disabled WMM, wow, man oh man, the streaming speed and downloading/uploading were breathtaking! It's a shame such a great product comes with that option enabled. So here's what you need to do:1. Go to router's IP address, which should be something like [...]2. Click on Applications & Gaming3. Look for QoS settings4. Disable WMM Support5. Save and Continue6. You're in business!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2013
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this router because my old wrt54g starting failing. I had dd-wrt installed on the old router and really liked the interface. Their site states that it supports the firmware, however I have not tried it yet.The router is ok. Had a few minor issues with the router stalling. This might be due to us having more computers connected to it than it is rated for.Also noticed that wifi slows to a crawl if b/g/n is enabled. Had to disable wireless n for older devices to not get terabad transfer speeds (~1Mbps wireless lan). I think we're currently getting 54Mbps over just g.Other notes:-No mounting holes on the back. Our old router was mounted on nails. This one does not have holes to mount the back, however it mounts well on mounting tape. Its been up for about a month so I'd say its up there for good.-Worth it at the refurbished price. I got a similar router (forgot the serial) for my parents for about double at Microcenter. They have no issues with it. Although they only have 2 laptops, a Roku, and a printer hooked up to it all using wireless n or ethernet.I'll update this review after trying 3rd party firmware.
